summary:
The Security Council,
 Reaffirming previous resolutions, particularly 1127 (1997) and 1412 (2002), 
Welcoming the Government of Angola and UNITA's signing of the Memorandum of Understanding Addendum to the Lusaka Protocol on 4 April 2002, 
 Welcoming efforts to restore peace, re-establish administration, and promote national reconciliation, 
 Reaffirming commitment to Angola's sovereignty and territorial integrity, 
 Emphasizing the importance of implementing the “Acordos de Paz”, the Lusaka Protocol, and relevant resolutions, 
Recalling the suspension of measures imposed by resolution 1127 (1997) for 90 days to facilitate UNITA members' travel for the peace process, 
Decides to:
1. Suspend measures imposed by paragraphs 4 (a) and (b) of resolution 1127 (1997) for an additional 90 days to encourage the peace process and national reconciliation;
2. Review these measures before the end of this period, considering all available information on the implementation of peace accords;
3. Remain actively seized of the matter.
